results.title: Oral Lisinopril Raises Tissue Levels of ACE2, the SARS-CoV-2 Receptor, in Healthy Male and Female Mice
results.text_hl: A sex difference was observed: kidney @GENE_ACE2 @GENE_70008 @@@ACE2@@@ levels were higher in male than in female @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ (p < 0.0001). Oral @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ increases @GENE_ACE2 @GENE_70008 @@@ACE2@@@, the cellular receptor for @SPECIES_2697049 @@@SARS-CoV-2@@@, in tissues that are relevant to the transmission and pathogenesis of @<m>DISEASE_COVID_19</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000086382 @@@COVID-19@@@.

citations.NLM: Brooks SD, Smith RL, Moreira AS, Ackerman HC. Oral Lisinopril Raises Tissue Levels of ACE2, the SARS-CoV-2 Receptor, in Healthy Male and Female Mice Front Pharmacol. 2022;13():798349. PMID: 35359831

results.title: Whey-Derived Peptides at the Heart of the COVID-19 Pandemic
results.text_hl: This dual activity distinguishes these @GENE_AP2B1 @GENE_163 @@@ACE@@@ inhibitory peptides from synthetic drugs, such as @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@Captopril@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ which were not shown to inhibit @GENE_ACE2 @GENE_59272 @@@ACE2@@@ activity, and may represent a potential strategy in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_COVID_19</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000086382 @@@COVID-19@@@.

citations.NLM: Chamata Y, Jackson KG, Watson KA, Jauregi P. Whey-Derived Peptides at the Heart of the COVID-19 Pandemic Int J Mol Sci. 2021 Oct 28;22(21):. PMID: 34769093

results.title: Molecular Docking and Dynamics Simulation Revealed the Potential Inhibitory Activity of ACEIs Against SARS-CoV-2 Targeting the hACE2 Receptor
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_COVID_19</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000086382 @@@Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_COVID_19</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000086382 @@@SARS-CoV-2@@@) or @<m>DISEASE_COVID_19</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000086382 @@@COVID-19@@@ was the name that the WHO designated for the disease caused by the @<m>DISEASE_COVID_19</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000086382 @@@novel coronavirus@@@ (Coronaviridae Study Group of the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses,).

citations.NLM: Al-Karmalawy AA, Dahab MA, Metwaly AM, Elhady SS, Elkaeed EB, Eissa IH, Darwish KM. Molecular Docking and Dynamics Simulation Revealed the Potential Inhibitory Activity of ACEIs Against SARS-CoV-2 Targeting the hACE2 Receptor Front Chem. 2021;9():661230. PMID: 34017819

results.title: A systematic review on COVID-19 vaccination and cosmetic filler reactions: A focus on case studies and original articles.

results.title: Standard headache and neuralgia treatments and SARS-CoV-2: opinion of the Spanish Society of Neurology's Headache Study Group
results.text_hl: We also recommend evaluating other treatment options in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ already taking @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ or @CHEMICAL_candesartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:C081643 @@@candesartan@@@ for @DISEASE_Migraine_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D008881 @@@migraine@@@ and presenting risk factors for severe @<m>DISEASE_COVID_19</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000086382 @@@COVID-19@@@ (Table 1 ).

citations.NLM: Morollón N, Belvís R, De Dios A, Pagès N, González-Oria C, Latorre G, Santos-Lasaosa S. Standard headache and neuralgia treatments and SARS-CoV-2: opinion of the Spanish Society of Neurology's Headache Study Group  Neurologia (Engl Ed). 2020 Nov-Dec;35(9):628-632. PMID: 32896463

results.title: [Standard headache and neuralgia treatments and SARS-CoV-2: opinion of the Spanish Society of Neurology's Headache Study Group].
results.text_hl: Material and methods: We collected information on the opinions of scientific societies and medicines agencies (American, European, and Spanish) to clarify doubts regarding the use of drugs such as @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, @CHEMICAL_candesartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:C081643 @@@candesartan@@@, @CHEMICAL_Ibuprofen @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007052 @@@ibuprofen@@@, corticosteroids, @CHEMICAL_Carbamazepine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002220 @@@carbamazepine@@@, and monoclonal antibodies targeting the calcitonin gene-related peptide in the context of the @<m>DISEASE_COVID_19</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000086382 @@@COVID-19@@@ pandemic.

citations.NLM: Morollón N, Belvís R, De Dios A, Pagès N, González-Oria C, Latorre G, Santos-Lasaosa S. [Standard headache and neuralgia treatments and SARS-CoV-2: opinion of the Spanish Society of Neurology's Headache Study Group]. Neurologia. 2020 Nov-Dec;35(9):628-632. PMID: 38620330
citations.BibTeX: @article{38620330, title={[Standard headache and neuralgia treatments and SARS-CoV-2: opinion of the Spanish Society of Neurology's Headache Study Group].}, author={Morollón N and Belvís R and De Dios A and Pagès N and González-Oria C and Latorre G and Santos-Lasaosa S}, journal={Neurologia}, volume={35}, number={9}, pages={628-632}}

results.title: Molecular docking, molecular dynamics simulations and reactivity, studies on approved drugs library targeting ACE2 and SARS-CoV-2 binding with ACE2.
results.text_hl: The reactivity, molecular docking and molecular dynamics were performed for two receptors @GENE_ACE2 @GENE_59272 @@@ACE2@@@ and [@SPECIES_2697049 @@@SARS-CoV-2@@@/@GENE_ACE2 @GENE_59272 @@@ACE2@@@] complex receptor in two active sites to find a ligand, which may inhibit @<m>DISEASE_COVID_19</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000086382 @@@COVID-19@@@. The results obtained from this study showed that @CHEMICAL_Ramipril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017257 @@@Ramipril@@@, @CHEMICAL_delapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:C047759 @@@Delapril@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ could bind with @GENE_ACE2 @GENE_59272 @@@ACE2@@@ receptor and [@SPECIES_2697049 @@@SARS-CoV-2@@@/@GENE_ACE2 @GENE_59272 @@@ACE2@@@] complex better than @CHEMICAL_Chloroquine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002738 @@@chloroquine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Hydroxychloroquine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006886 @@@hydroxychloroquine@@@.

citations.NLM: Khelfaoui H, Harkati D, Saleh BA. Molecular docking, molecular dynamics simulations and reactivity, studies on approved drugs library targeting ACE2 and SARS-CoV-2 binding with ACE2. J Biomol Struct Dyn. 2021 Nov;39(18):7246-7262. PMID: 32752951
citations.BibTeX: @article{32752951, title={Molecular docking, molecular dynamics simulations and reactivity, studies on approved drugs library targeting ACE2 and SARS-CoV-2 binding with ACE2.}, author={Khelfaoui H and Harkati D and Saleh BA}, journal={J Biomol Struct Dyn}, volume={39}, number={18}, pages={7246-7262}}
